article.headline: Alaska Anchorage 80, Texas State 59
article.story: ANCHORAGE, Alaska (AP) -- Peter Bullock and Kemmy Burgess each scored 20 points to lead Alaska Anchorage to an 80-59 victory over Texas State in the consolation game of the Carrs/Safeway Great Alaska Shootout on Friday. Terry Conerway scored 21 of his 30 points in the second half and had eight rebounds for Texas State (1-3). The Bobcats led 11-8 at 16:09 of the first half, but scored just one field goal in the next 10 minutes. Alaska Anchorage went on a 17-2 run and built a 25-13 lead behind 11 points from Burgess. The Division II Seawolves (4-1) extended the lead to 39-20 at the break behind a pair of 3-pointers by Adam Fitt-Chappell and three baskets by Bullock. The Bobcats scored 10 straight points, eight by Conerway, to open the second half and closed within 39-30. But Alaska Anchorage point guard Aaron Burgess fed Bullock for consecutive slam dunks, and Texas State could get no closer. Alaska Anchorage shot 27-for-30 from the line. The Bobcats did not shoot a free throw in the first half, but made 16 of 20 in the second. Bullock finished with nine rebounds. Zach Allison had 13 points and eight rebounds for Texas State.
